intro: Beatonia bracteolata, commonly known as the bracteolata beatonia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy underside. Its flowering period usually occurs during the warmer months, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
